thread.title: Chargers prep for potential big move
thread.title_full: Chargers prep for potential big move

title: Chargers prep for potential big move
text:
Posted: 3:55 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015 Chargers prep for potential big move San Diego Chargers quarterback Philip Rivers (17) throws during the first half of an NFL football game against the Green Bay Packers, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015, in Green Bay, Wis. (AP Photo/Darron Cummings) Related By Cox Media Group National Content Desk 
The San Diego Chargers are looking to move and team officials are getting the paperwork ready. 
The Chargers plan to file the official relocation papers with the NFL to move to Los Angeles, KCAL reported. 
Team officials have been sitting down with those from the Oakland Raiders to have a $1.7 billion joint stadium that will be located in Carson, California. 
While there had been rumors, the Chargers front office had not confirmed the plans until this weekend. 
The Chargers are also talking with officials in San Diego to build a stadium in the city’s downtown area. Right now they play in the Mission Valley area. 
Some believe the relocation to Los Angeles is a bargaining ploy to get San Diego to agree to that new stadium. 
There has also been talk of the St. Louis Rams moving from Missouri to a separate $1.8 billion football stadium in California’s Inglewood area, St. Louis Post-Dispatch reported. 
The Rams moved from Los Angeles to St. Louis in 1995 after 49 years in California, according to the Rams’ website .
